title: How to Make Kid‐Friendly Soups

steps.headline: Heat the butter and garlic in a pot.
steps.description: This soup takes about 20-30 minutes to prepare and is a big hit with kids. Start by letting the butter and minced garlic heat up until the butter starts to the foam. It should give off a garlicky smell in the pan. Do not let the garlic burn in the butter or overheat.

steps.headline: Add the onion and carrot.
steps.description: Stir them around in the butter and garlic with a spoon. Let the vegetables cook for three to five minutes until they become soft.

steps.headline: Pour in the tomatoes, the oregano, and the stock.
steps.description: Crumble the stock cube and pour it into the pot with the tomatoes and the oregano. Then, let the soup simmer on the stove for around 20 minutes. After 20 minutes, stir in the creme fraiche with a spoon.

steps.headline: Blend and season to taste.
steps.description: Take the soup off the stove. Then, use an immersion blender to blend the soup together so it is smooth. You can also pour the soup into a blender in batches and blend it up. Do this with care as the soup will be hot. Once the soup is blended, taste it and add seasoning as needed. It may need a pinch of sugar if it tastes acidic. You can also add salt and pepper to the soup.

steps.headline: Serve with grilled cheese or cheesy bread.
steps.description: Tomato soup pairs well with grilled cheese or cheesy bread, made fresh along with the soup. You can keep the soup warm on low heat while you prepare the grilled cheese or the cheesy bread. Then, serve everything hot as a perfect meal for your kid.

steps.headline: Cook the bacon in a large, deep skillet.
steps.description: This soup can be made on the stove in 45 minutes. Start by placing the chopped bacon in a skillet that has deep sides and cook over medium-high heat. Turn them occasionally with a spatula so they brown evenly for about 5 to 8 minutes. Once they’re done cooking, drain the bacon onto a paper towel-lined plate. Keep 1 teaspoon of the bacon drippings.

steps.headline: Fill the skillet with water and bring to a boil.
steps.description: Lightly salt the water and let it boil over high heat. When the water is boiling, stir in the macaroni. Cook the pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the pasta is cooked but still firm to the bite. This should take about 8 minutes. Once the pasta is done cooking, drain it into a colander in the sink and set aside.

steps.headline: Heat the bacon drippings in a large pan.
steps.description: Pour the bacon drippings into a large saucepan over medium heat. Put the onion in the bacon drippings and cook them until they are translucent. This should take around 5 minutes. Then, stir in the garlic and cook for 2 minutes, until the garlic is softened.

steps.headline: Add the other ingredients.
steps.description: Add the bacon bits, the chicken broth, the cheese sauce or grated cheese, the chicken bouillon granules, the ground red pepper, the ground black pepper, the red pepper flakes, and the macaroni. Stir everything around with a spoon so it is combined.

steps.headline: Bring the soup to a boil and then reduce to a simmer.
steps.description: Stir the soup occasionally to help the flavors blend. Let it simmer for about five minutes. Serve the soup hot with a healthy salad or bread on the side.

methods.name: Making Chicken or Turkey Noodle Soup

steps.headline: Get a large saucepan.
steps.description: Heat the saucepan over medium-high heat. Coat the pan with cooking spray or use a neutral oil like vegetable or canola oil in the pan. Add the carrot, onion, and garlic. Mix them around with a spoon. Saute the ingredients for five minutes, until the onion is lightly browned.

steps.headline: Add the celery, salt, and pepper.
steps.description: Saute the ingredients for three minutes. Stir them occasionally with a spoon. Then, add the broth, soy sauce, egg noodles, and bay leaf. Bring the soup to a boil. Then, reduce the heat and let it simmer for 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the shredded turkey or chicken.
steps.description: Cook for three minutes and then discard the bay leaf. Taste the soup and add salt or ground pepper if needed. Serve hot with a crackers on the side.

steps.headline: Get a large cooking pan.
steps.description: Add the oil to the pan and heat it on medium-high heat. Add the carrots and onions. Let them cook for 5 minutes until the start to soften.

steps.headline: Put in the vegetable stock and the tomatoes.
Add the pasta.
steps.description: Stir in the pasta and raise the temperature to boil. Once the ingredients start to boil, simmer it for two minutes until the pasta is just cooked. This will prevent the pasta from getting soggy.

steps.headline: Stir in the basil and season the soup to taste.
steps.description: Season the soup with salt and pepper as you’d like. Then, serve the soup in bowls garnished with Parmesan. You can also serve bread or crackers on the side.

text: Making Tomato Soup Heat the butter and garlic in a pot. This soup takes about 20-30 minutes to prepare and is a big hit with kids. Start by letting the butter and minced garlic heat up until the butter starts to the foam. It should give off a garlicky smell in the pan. Do not let the garlic burn in the butter or overheat. Add the onion and carrot. Stir them around in the butter and garlic with a spoon. Let the vegetables cook for three to five minutes until they become soft. Pour in the tomatoes, the oregano, and the stock. Crumble the stock cube and pour it into the pot with the tomatoes and the oregano. Then, let the soup simmer on the stove for around 20 minutes. After 20 minutes, stir in the creme fraiche with a spoon. Blend and season to taste. Take the soup off the stove. Then, use an immersion blender to blend the soup together so it is smooth. You can also pour the soup into a blender in batches and blend it up. Do this with care as the soup will be hot. Once the soup is blended, taste it and add seasoning as needed. It may need a pinch of sugar if it tastes acidic. You can also add salt and pepper to the soup. Serve with grilled cheese or cheesy bread. Then, serve everything hot as a perfect meal for your kid. Preparing Mac and Cheese Soup Cook the bacon in a large, deep skillet. This soup can be made on the stove in 45 minutes. Start by placing the chopped bacon in a skillet that has deep sides and cook over medium-high heat. Turn them occasionally with a spatula so they brown evenly for about 5 to 8 minutes. Once they’re done cooking, drain the bacon onto a paper towel-lined plate. Keep 1 teaspoon of the bacon drippings. Fill the skillet with water and bring to a boil. Lightly salt the water and let it boil over high heat. When the water is boiling, stir in the macaroni. Cook the pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the pasta is cooked but still firm to the bite. This should take about 8 minutes. Once the pasta is done cooking, drain it into a colander in the sink and set aside. Heat the bacon drippings in a large pan. Pour the bacon drippings into a large saucepan over medium heat. Put the onion in the bacon drippings and cook them until they are translucent. This should take around 5 minutes. Then, stir in the garlic and cook for 2 minutes, until the garlic is softened. Add the other ingredients. Add the bacon bits, the chicken broth, the cheese sauce or grated cheese, the chicken bouillon granules, the ground red pepper, the ground black pepper, the red pepper flakes, and the macaroni. Stir everything around with a spoon so it is combined. Bring the soup to a boil and then reduce to a simmer. Stir the soup occasionally to help the flavors blend. Let it simmer for about five minutes. Serve the soup hot with a healthy salad or bread on the side. Making Chicken or Turkey Noodle Soup Get a large saucepan. Heat the saucepan over medium-high heat. Coat the pan with cooking spray or use a neutral oil like vegetable or canola oil in the pan. Add the carrot, onion, and garlic. Mix them around with a spoon. Saute the ingredients for five minutes, until the onion is lightly browned. Add the celery, salt, and pepper. Saute the ingredients for three minutes. Stir them occasionally with a spoon. Then, add the broth, soy sauce, egg noodles, and bay leaf. Bring the soup to a boil. Then, reduce the heat and let it simmer for 5 minutes. Add the shredded turkey or chicken. Cook for three minutes and then discard the bay leaf. Taste the soup and add salt or ground pepper if needed. Serve hot with a crackers on the side. Preparing Vegetable Pasta Soup Get a large cooking pan. Add the oil to the pan and heat it on medium-high heat. Add the carrots and onions. Let them cook for 5 minutes until the start to soften. Put in the vegetable stock and the tomatoes. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add the peas and beans. Then, simmer for 5 more minutes. Add the pasta. Stir in the pasta and raise the temperature to boil. Once the ingredients start to boil, simmer it for two minutes until the pasta is just cooked. This will prevent the pasta from getting soggy. Stir in the basil and season the soup to taste. Season the soup with salt and pepper as you’d like. Then, serve the soup in bowls garnished with Parmesan. You can also serve bread or crackers on the side.
